WorkItem.Description: This library needs to be a PCL so that it can be compatible with Xamarin.Forms.

Comments.Message: With the announcement of the discontinuation of WPF and the deepening of the strategic partnership with Xamarin at Connect(); 2014, this becomes a more prominent feature/request. :)

WPF discontinued? Do you have any source for that, I read other things such as "WPF Lives":
http://www.i-programmer.info/news/89-net/7973-wpf-lives.html

And wpf has an updated roadmap:
http://blogs.msdn.com/b/dotnet/archive/2014/11/12/the-roadmap-for-wpf.aspx

That roadmap is how I am basing the expiration, actually.  It is being supported until the current version of .NET expires, which is until 2023.  This is the same as how Silverlight is being supported until it expires in 2021...

And also, WPF is not going open source.  If it were, then this would be a different matter altogether. :)  You have to read the tea leaves here, but basically it appears that "all power" is being put into the relationship with Xamarin for XAML-based development.  Which is not a bad thing... Xamarin is pretty cool, and Xamarin.Forms is even cooler.  It's basically what MSFT should have announced at Mix 2011... you know, over 3 years ago. :P
